title: Chinese Spicy Pickled Napa Cabbage
summary: Chinese Spicy Pickled Napa Cabbage is a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 recipe with 12 servings. One serving contains 13 calories, 1g of protein, and 0g of fat. For 22 cents per serving, this recipe covers 2% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. A mixture of napa cabbage, sea salt, ginger, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is a very reasonably priced recipe for fans of Chinese food. Not a lot of people really liked this side dish. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 34%. This score is not so spectacular. Try Pickled Napa Cabbage, Pickled Napa Cabbage with Umeboshi Plums, and Chinese Napa Cabbage Salad with a Crunchy Topping for similar recipes.
instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Cut Napa cabbage into sixths, core and slice across each section into 2-inch (5 cm) wide sections; mix well with salt. Cover; set aside at room temperature for 1 day in warm weather or 2 in cooler weather (taste after 1 day to see if the cabbage has soured). Rinse lightly under cold running water; drain, squeezing out excess moisture. Set aside.                                                     In a dry frying pan over medium heat, toast Szechuan peppercorns until fragrant and slightly darkened. Toast chilies until fragrant and slightly darker in color. Stir together cabbage, Szechuan peppercorns, chilies, ginger and garlic (if using), pressing with your hands to extract liquid from cabbage and to break up the chilies. Cover; refrigerate 1 day before serving.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Cut Napa cabbage into sixths, core and slice across each section into 2-inch (5 cm) wide sections; mix well with salt. Cover; set aside at room temperature for 1 day in warm weather or 2 in cooler weather (taste after 1 day to see if the cabbage has soured). Rinse lightly under cold running water; drain, squeezing out excess moisture. Set aside.

In a dry frying pan over medium heat, toast Szechuan peppercorns until fragrant and slightly darkened. Toast chilies until fragrant and slightly darker in color. Stir together cabbage, Szechuan peppercorns, chilies, ginger and garlic (if using), pressing with your hands to extract liquid from cabbage and to break up the chilies. Cover; refrigerate 1 day before serving.
